Package ChessSpecific

Class ChessBoard

java.lang.Object
ChessSpecific.ChessBoard
public class ChessBoard extends Object
ChessBoard - Interactive Robot Chess ChessBoard class is the internal representation of a chess board. It uses the Protocol.ChessEngine class to perform player and chess-engine moves. It uses all the other classes listed in the ChessSpecific package. It creates a two-dimensional array 8x8 elements of type Cell. These cells can hold chess pieces.

3rd party code is used in this class. It is an adaptions from GitHub user: Stevoisiak. Link to the original code: Github Link. This class represents the ChessBoard.java file Accessed 30th of April 2023

Following methods are adaptation and reworked functionality from the original work:

  • setStartPosition()
  • ChessBoard()
Version:
0.1 ( Initial development )., 0.2 ( Second development )., 1.0 ( Initial release ).
Author:
Omar Ibrahim

  • Method Details

    • setStartPosition

      private void setStartPosition()
      Sets the chessboard into its start position

    • convertToMoveFormat

      private void convertToMoveFormat(Cell initialCell, Cell destinationCell, StringBuilder sb)
      Get a chessMoveFormat from initial cell to destination cell. Example of chess move is: a1a2, c2c4
      Parameters:
      initialCell - Cell where the chess piece gets moved from
      destinationCell - Cell where the chess piece gets moved to
      sb - stringBuilder that gets manipulated to hold the chess move

    • convertFromMoveFormat

      private int[] convertFromMoveFormat(String move)
      Converts a chess move to cell Position The return is a 4 element integer with first two elements being x and y for first cell and element 3 and 4 being x and y for the second cell
      Parameters:
      move - chess move to convert
      Returns:
      returns an array with 4 values

    • castleMove

      private void castleMove(String moveFormat)
      This method performs the rook move of the castle.
      Parameters:
      moveFormat - supplied chess move

      private void promotion(String moveFormat)
      This Function performce a promotion if it is one
      Parameters:

    • getCellAtPosition

      public Cell getCellAtPosition(int x, int y)
      Get a cell at a specific position
      Parameters:
      x - X position of the cell
      y - Y position of the cell
      Returns:
      returns a copy of the cell

    • playerMove

      public boolean playerMove(int activeCellX, int activeCellY, int clickedCellX, int clickedCellY, char toPromoteInto) throws ProtocolException, IOException
      Making a player move. This is done by calling the player move method in the ChessEngine class.
      Parameters:
      activeCellX - startingCell X position
      activeCellY - startingCell Y position
      clickedCellX - destinationCell X position
      clickedCellY - destinationCell Y position
      toPromoteInto - add a value for promotion move
      Returns:
      returns true if successfull otherwise false if we do not have a chess move or promotion move
      Throws:
      ProtocolException - thrown by makePlayerMove from the ChessEngine class
      IOException - thrown by makePlayerMove from the ChessEngine class

    • chessEngineMove

      public void chessEngineMove() throws ProtocolException, IOException
      Making a chess engine move. This is done by calling the chessEngineMove method in the ChessEngine class.
      Throws:
      ProtocolException - thrown by makePlayerMove from the ChessEngine class
      IOException - thrown by makePlayerMove from the ChessEngine class
